Module ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2
Package ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes

Class SmartShape

java.lang.Object
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes.Shape
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes.Squiggle
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes.SmartShape
public class SmartShape extends Squiggle
SmartShape extends the Squiggle class to provide functionality for creating shapes that can be finalized into closed polygons based on certain conditions, such as proximity of points and angular tolerance.

    • paint

      public void paint(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext g2d)
      Paints the shape on the given graphics context. If the shape is still a squiggle, it delegates painting to the parent class. Otherwise, it draws the finalized shape as a polygon.
      Overrides:
      paint in class Squiggle
      Parameters:

    • includeCursor

      public boolean includeCursor(Point p)
      Checks if a given point is inside the shape. If the shape is a squiggle, the check is delegated to the parent class. If the shape is finalized as a polygon, the method checks if the point is inside the polygon.
      Overrides:
      includeCursor in class Squiggle
      Parameters:
      p - The point to check
      Returns:
      True if the point is inside the shape, false otherwise

    • finalizeShape

      public void finalizeShape()
      Finalizes the squiggle into a closed shape by interpolating between points and forming a polygon if the first and last points are close enough.

      Iterates through the points and selects vertices based on angle and distance to ensure the shape is smooth and forms a closed loop.

      The algorithm works as follows: - Iterate through the points, keeping track of the vertices that should form the final shape. - For each point in the squiggle, attempt to find the best fitting vertex that minimizes the angle between the current vertex, the current point, and any other point further down the path. - A vertex is considered valid if it is far enough from its neighbours, and the angle between the points is small enough to be considered part of the shape's smooth curve. - Once the best vertex is determined, it is added to the final shape's list of vertices, and the search continues from this new vertex. - After processing all points, check if the shape can be closed by comparing the angle between the first and last vertex. If they form a small enough angle, they are connected, completing the polygon. - If the shape is successfully closed, the squiggle is transformed into a polygon; otherwise, it remains a squiggle.
      Overrides:
      finalizeShape in class Shape
